heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 13 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 47.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.5°C), inside temperature (down 1.6°C), and outside temperature (down 1.5°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (down 163 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 2.8°C), cloud levels (up 325 m), and inside temperature (up 2.7°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 163.2m higher than yesterday, 50.7m lower than the past week, 325.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 926m and a peak of 1357m, averaging 1248.3m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures may feel cool outdoors. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the air will feel dry and near calm conditions. Possible light showers, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and the light is absent. Weather should be calm and steady.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
